column3: Great job completing your first CS1 lab!
needs to be able to run without Syntax Errors
This goodbye code should be in its own file, not hello.py
Q2 answer was Hyenas. You needed to dig through the text of files a bit more.
Q3 answer was Dewey, Cheatham, and Howe. decode.py would decode the injustice.txt file
Q6 answer was Rober Downey Jr.
Variable names should be descriptive (sum, if calculating sum, etc.)
In the future, your return (and print) statements will need to match the capitalization, type, etc. as what's specified in the lab document.
Good job having your print statement correctly describe the operator
Print statement should correctly describe the operation (sum: +, product: *)
Readability would be increased by having blank lines around code chunks
Readability would be increased if you don't have text running off the side of the window (this is very true for comments going forward!)
